universum.studios.android.ui.widget

Class CircularNumberPicker

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.view.View
      • universum.studios.android.ui.widget.ViewWidget
        • universum.studios.android.ui.widget.CircularNumberPicker
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Drawable.Callback, AccessibilityEventSource, KeyEvent.Callback, FontWidget, Widget

    public class CircularNumberPicker
extends ViewWidget
implements FontWidget
    A view that can be used to present a circular picker within a layout that allows to a user to pick one number from the predefined set of numbers that are drawn in arc.

    Use setNumbers(int[]) to specify set of numbers from which can a user pick one. If you want to allow to the user to pick from "more discrete" interval than that which is described by the count of specified numbers, you can do so by specifying selection range via setSelectionRange(int) that will be used to properly pick the current selected number. This is useful for example when you want to display only 12 numbers representing set of minutes within one hour, but want to allow to the user to pick the desired minute from the range [0, 59], than you will specify numbers for minutes CircularNumberPicker.setNumbers({0, 5, ..., 55}) and selection range CircularNumberPicker.setSelectionRange(60) so the user will be able to pick also minutes between [0, 5], [5, 10] and so on.

    Initial selected number can be specified via setSelection(int) and the current selected can be obtained via getSelection().

    Note, that this view saves its current state, so it can be later restored (in case of orientation change for example).

    Callbacks

    Use CircularNumberPicker.OnNumberSelectionListener to listen for callback for a selected number. This listener can be registered via setOnNumberSelectionListener(OnNumberSelectionListener). For callback for changed number use CircularNumberPicker.OnNumberChangeListener that can be registered via setOnNumberChangeListener(OnNumberChangeListener) of which callback is fired whenever user changes highlighted number by dragging a selection indicator.

    XML attributes

    See ViewWidget, CircularNumberPicker Attributes

    Default style attribute

    uiNumberPickerCircularStyle
    Author:
    Martin Albedinsky

      • CircularNumberPicker

        public CircularNumberPicker(@NonNull
                            Context context,
                            @Nullable
                            AttributeSet attrs,
                            @AttrRes
                            int defStyleAttr,
                            @StyleRes
                            int defStyleRes)
        Creates a new instance of CircularNumberPicker for the given context.
        Parameters:
        context - Context in which will be the new view presented.
        attrs - Set of Xml attributes used to configure the new instance of this view.
        defStyleAttr - An attribute which contains a reference to a default style resource for this view within a theme of the given context.
        defStyleRes - Resource id of the default style for the new view.

      • setNumbers

        public void setNumbers(@Nullable
                       int[] numbers)
        Sets a set of numbers that should be presented within this picker. The given numbers will be drawn in the circular area within this picker.

        Note, that this will also set a value of the selection range to size of the specified numbers. If this picker requires different selection range, you should change it after this call via setSelectionRange(int).

        Parameters:
        numbers - The desired set of numbers.
        See Also:
        ui:uiPickerNumbers, getNumbers()

      • getNumbers

        @Nullable
public int[] getNumbers()
        Returns the set of numbers presented within this picker. These are the numbers that are drawn in the circular area of this picker.
        Returns:
        Set of numbers.
        See Also:
        setNumbers(int[])

      • getNumbersCount

        Returns the count of the numbers presented within this picker.
        Returns:
        Count of current numbers.
        See Also:
        getNumbers()

        Parameters:

        See Also:

      • setTypeface

        public void setTypeface(@Nullable
                        Typeface typeface,
                        int style)
        Sets the typeface and style in which the numbers text should be displayed, and turns on the fake bold and italic bits in the Paint if the Typeface that you provided does not have all the bits in the style that you specified.
        Specified by:
        setTypeface in interface FontWidget
        Parameters:
        typeface - The desired typeface. May be null to create default one from the specified style.
        style - One of Typeface.NORMAL, Typeface.BOLD, Typeface.ITALIC or Typeface.BOLD_ITALIC.

                                  int resId)
        Same as setSelectionIndicator(android.graphics.drawable.Drawable) for resource id.
        Parameters:

      • setSelectionIndicator

        public void setSelectionIndicator(@Nullable
                                  Drawable indicator)
        Sets the drawable used to draw the number selection indicator.
        Parameters:
        indicator - The desired drawable for selection indicator. May be null to clear the current one.
        See Also:
        ui:uiSelectionIndicator, setSelectionIndicatorTintList(ColorStateList), setSelectionIndicatorTintMode(PorterDuff.Mode), getSelectionIndicator()

      • getSelectionIndicator

        @Nullable
public Drawable getSelectionIndicator()
        Returns the current selection indicator's drawable.

        Note, that on pre LOLLIPOP Android versions this method will return an instance of TintDrawable if tint has been applied via setSelectionIndicatorTintList(ColorStateList).

        The original wrapped indicator drawable can be obtained via DrawableWrapper.getDrawable().

        Returns:
        Selection indicator's drawable.
        See Also:
        setSelectionIndicator(Drawable)

      • setSelectionIndicatorTintList

        public void setSelectionIndicatorTintList(@Nullable
                                          ColorStateList tint)
        Applies a tint to the selection indicator. This call does not modify the current tint mode, which is PorterDuff.Mode#SRC_IN by default.
        Parameters:
        tint - The tint to apply, may be null to clear the current tint.
        See Also:
        ui:uiSelectionIndicatorTint, getSelectionIndicatorTintList()

      • getSelectionIndicatorTintList

        @Nullable
public ColorStateList getSelectionIndicatorTintList()
        Returns the tint applied to the selection indicator's graphics.
        Returns:
        The discrete indicator's drawable tint.
        See Also:
        setSelectionIndicatorTintList(ColorStateList)

      • setSelectionIndicatorTintMode

        public void setSelectionIndicatorTintMode(@Nullable
                                          PorterDuff.Mode tintMode)
        Specifies the blending mode used to apply the tint specified by setSelectionIndicatorTintList(ColorStateList)} to the selection indicator. The default mode is PorterDuff.Mode#SRC_IN.
        Parameters:
        tintMode - The blending mode used to apply the tint, may be null to clear the current tint.
        See Also:
        ui:uiSelectionIndicatorTintMode, getSelectionIndicatorTintMode()

      • getSelectionIndicatorTintMode

        @Nullable
public PorterDuff.Mode getSelectionIndicatorTintMode()
        Returns the blending mode used to apply the tint to the selection indicator's graphics.
        Returns:
        The selection indicator's graphics blending mode used to apply the tint.
        See Also:
        setSelectionIndicatorTintMode(PorterDuff.Mode)
